title: MD
biography: Institute of Organic Chemistry and Biochemistry of the Czech Academy of Sciences is a research institute under the Czech Academy of Sciences (CAS). The institute centers around research in the fields of organic chemistry, biochemistry and neighboring disciplines, mostly oriented at applications in medicine and environment. It is known for its contribution in the development of key drugs against HIV and HBV. The institute also takes part in university education, supervising master's and doctoral theses.
aiSummary: Antonín HolýInstitute of Organic Chemistry is a czech national prize specialist with an H-index of 4 at Antiviral Pharmacology (Member). Has been published in Journal of environmental sciences (China), Journal of biomaterials science. Polymer edition, Chemical science. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
